alert.note: Alert for Boise (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 3:40PM MDT until May 07 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Idaho... Middle Fork Payette River Near Crouch affecting Boise County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Payette River...including Crouch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Middle Fork Payette River Near Crouch. * WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.8 feet, Low-lying areas near the intersection of Banks-Lowman Road and Middle Fork Road will be impacted by floodwaters. Water will encroach on Weilmunster Park and the Garden Valley Trail. The river will be out of its banks and impact adjacent lowlands from Crouch upriver past Elk Springs Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM MDT Thursday, May 04 the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value near 12.0 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 11.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 05/20/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 345 PM MDT.
